KUNGFU.AI is the leading AI consultancy. We partner with clients to realize the real business value or Artificial Intelligence to help them compete and lead in the age of AI. We provide strategy, engineering, and operations services to achieve AI-centric transformation.From sparking big ideas to delivering practical solutions, we help our clients unlock the business value of AI. We guide our customers on their AI journey, exploring a world of possibilities and then grounding that with a roadmap and practical deliverables that are embedded into their products and processes. Our innovative engineers continually research the latest AI techniques. We use that knowledge to build bespoke AI solutions for customers that multiply their business value.Outside of our virtual walls we are painters, foodies, cocktail connoisseurs, musicians, crossword-doers, athletes, dungeon masters, non-profit board members, and more. We’d welcome the opportunity to meet you.The Head of Delivery is a strategic business leader responsible for overseeing the successful delivery of client work for KUNGFU.AI and will report to our Managing Director. The Delivery Team at KUNGFU.AI is composed of world-class AI strategists, machine learning engineers, data scientists, software engineers, and program managers. As the Head of Delivery you will have the opportunity to work with all of these talented, caring, and creative individuals to define and deliver state-of-the-art AI/ML solutions.The ideal candidate has experience in professional services, new business development, project delivery success, process improvement and standardization, resource management and allocation, risk management and mitigation, and financial operations.Here’s what you’ll be doing:New Business Development SupportWorking closely with engineering, strategy, growth, and executive leadership in the formulation of proposals, project estimates, and innovative service offeringsAccountable for bringing the right people together in a team to develop new solution approaches, including budget estimates, timelines, resource plans, project plans and client success strategiesResource Allocation and ManagementAccountable for staffing processes, demand forecasting, and reporting of our resource utilization and project metrics, including but not limited to average rate, as delivered margin, Csat/NPS, etcOverseeing communication between growth and delivery teams - in collaboration with project team leadership and finance you will facilitate forecasting and estimating resources, understanding as sold margins and the larger financial impact, and SOW approvalsProgram and Project Delivery Leadership and OversightLeading all aspects of our delivery strategy and executionDeveloping and implementing project management methodologies, establishing clear project goals and deliverables, monitoring progress, and ensuring projects are delivered on time, within budget, and meet the client's requirementsAccountable for working with our finance team on invoicing terms and billing, metrics and reporting (ex. forecast earned revenue projections, delivery margins, team utilization, budgeting resources, etc.), contractor management, and vendor & purchase approvalsBuilding upon and improving project management best practices, tooling and methodologies. Owning and regularly improving standardized project workflows using routine and consistent feedback mechanisms to improve delivery qualityAccountable for identifying, assessing, and managing risks throughout the project lifecycle. This involves developing risk management strategies, implementing risk mitigation plans, and proactively addressing any issues or obstacles that may impact project timelines or deliverablesMaintain objectives and key results (OKRs) for the delivery team to constantly grow and improve the delivery organizationClient Relationship ManagementPlaying a key role in managing client expectations, ensuring client satisfaction, and acting as a point of contact for escalated issues or concerns. Collaborate with clients to understand their needs, provide regular updates on project progress, and address any challenges that arise during the course of the engagementOwning and creating relationships with relevant external vendors and firms that may be required on occasion to deliver projects to our clientsIdentifying opportunities for expansion of engagements beyond allocated work and aiding the growth team in pursuit of these new engagementsPM Team Management and MentorshipScaling our current Program Management team and implementing the right practices at the right timeWorking cross-functionally on workforce planning and organizational structure Growing and mentoring our Program Management team by building out team structure, responsibilities, role definitions and hiring practicesActing as a catalyst for Program Management team growth by providing mentorship, upskilling and career development opportunities Ensuring that the members of the Program Management team have everything they need to succeedAnd here's what we're looking forYou are an accomplished, caring, and creative leader who can speak to most (or all) of the bullets below. If you’re on the fence about whether you are a fit - we still want you to apply!A leader with many years of experience in scaling boutique professional services firms that deliver bespoke solutions to a wide range of clientsYou have experience delivering full life-cycle projects in artificial intelligence/machine learning or a similar high-tech field (software development/analytics)A track record of successfully growing accounts and partnershipsYou’ve led and coordinated cross-functional teams to ensure on-time and on-budget delivery, and with this experience you can mentor and be a sounding board for senior members of the PM teamYou enjoy interacting with clients and have a lot of experience doing so - enough that you can be a mentor and drop-in when someone on your team needs help with a client or team interactionYou know how to spot risks before they become issues and have successfully navigated your teams around them. ‘Proactive’ is an adjective commonly used to describe youYou have experience with PSAs and have been involved in selecting, implementing and integrating them into professional service organizationsWhat's in it for you?This is a full-time remote position. Compensation includes competitive salary, company stock grant, top (‘gold’) level of health, dental and vision insurance (KUNGFU.AI covers 100% of your premiums and 50% for any dependents), health and dependent flexible spending accounts, short- and long-term disability insurance, unlimited vacation (that you're encouraged to take), paid parental leave, and more. If this sounds like the right role for you, we can’t wait to meet you!KUNGFU.AI CultureWe are committed to building an inclusive culture that’s professional and hardworking, while also fun, collaborative and open. We are proud to be the first company to take The Startup Diversity and Inclusion Pledge, which one of our co-founders started. We actively encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workforce fosters more creative ideas, conversations, and results.We also believe in using AI for Good in both our client projects and our corporate philanthropy, where we dedicate time to work on pro bono projects for the greater good.We value passion, courage, and original thinking.You should take ownership over the things you build and be eager to learn new skills.You should have a passion for teamwork and making others around you successful.You should be a self-starter and have a strong work ethic.We are an early stage company, so we all perform work outside of our job description every day, and you should expect to be given and take opportunities to do the same.
